page.title: 14DURHAM CATHEDRAL
page.content: nave and in between them,the great Norman arches,with their different patterns,notably the Dog-Tooth pattern.On the western end of the nave lies the Galilee Chapel,containing the tomb of{Venerable Bede.}At the other end is the tomb of St.Cuthbert,above which is a magnificent representation of God in majesty.Behind this is the enormous{Rose Window. } At the crossing of the transepts is a superb wooden pulpit and the site is overlooked by the ancient clock,which escaped destruction by Scottish prisoners in 1346 because of a thistle carved near the top.This essay is insufficient to recount in detail the amazing splendour of{Durham Cathedral.
